metadata.Title: CVE-2018-9846 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Roundcube from versions 1.2.0 to 1.3.5, with the archive plugin enabled and configured, it's possible to exploit the unsanitized, user-controlled "_uid" parameter (in an archive.php _task=mail&_mbox=INBOX&_action=plugin.move2archive request) to perform an MX (IMAP) injection attack by placing an IMAP command after a %0d%0a sequence. NOTE: this is less easily exploitable in 1.3.4 and later because of a Same Origin Policy protection mechanism.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-9846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

roundcube - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-core - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-mysql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-pgsql - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-plugins - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
roundcube-sqlite3 - 1.3.6+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: roundcube package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.6+dfsg.1-1').
